messages.message:
quick question, who implemented the new file upload design in build and converse? figma (https://www.figma.com/design/j2OVMRvWOaGgeOuWSU83eW/Pollen-Core-Components?node-id=7299-14904&t=H9wQwKBFiQwer2yT-4) | gdoc (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ElguGvA-FSb1H6VcGKPgbT43kYhVw3zUMX60nbLFxp0/edit#heading=h.k56o9cyvu079)
• the icon appears to be inside an oval instead of a circle
• we do not need the line about file types and size limits
i implemented the changes, but i haven’t implemented the drop zone changes (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ElguGvA-FSb1H6VcGKPgbT43kYhVw3zUMX60nbLFxp0/edit?pli=1#heading=h.r014fkokz6n0) yet

> • the icon appears to be inside an oval instead of a circle
good catch! i’ll fix the shape around the icon

> • we do not need the line about file types and size limits
are we sure about this? if the user uploads an invalid file, we will show an error toast, but the entire digitization job will fail

the text doesn’t seem to over-complicate the UI to me, and it will prevent users from seeing unexpected errors
